newsitem.title: FRANCE: Danone H1 net attrib profit rises.
newsitem.headline: Danone H1 net attrib profit rises.

text.p: (Figures in millions of French francs unless stated)
Operating income by divisions breaks down as follows:

NOTE - Danone said in a statement that in 1996 a certain number of unallocated expense items were reclassified at a division level. To allow comparison, 1995 operating income by division was adjusted on the same basis.

It said the results reflected gains in existing business and first consolidation of business outside Europe. The latter includes biscuit-making in China and dairy products in eastern Europe and Argentina.

The operating margin -- operating income as a percentage of sales -- stood at 8.9 percent, up from the 8.8 percent for full year 1995. Operating income from business outside western Europe rose 26.4 percent to make a significantly larger contribution to the consolidated total.

Comparison of net income with that for the same period of 1995 was affected by the increase in French tax rates last year which applied to the whole year but was recorded only in the second half of 1995. After adjustment for this factor, net income for the first half of 1996 showed a 5.1 percent increase.
In view of these results, "the group continues to expect a full-year rise of six percent in net income for 1996," it said.
